==DCT3 GSM Traces==
  * A selection of GSM protocol trace files (as well as the one on our Downloads page) are available [http://wiki.thc.org/gsm/debugtrace here] from the THC Wiki.
  * Additional information on obtaining DCT3 trace files is available [https://svn.berlin.ccc.de/projects/airprobe/wiki/tracelog here]
  * [http://www.wireshark.org Wireshark] supports reading these files, as of at least 1.1.4-SVN-28442 (or maybe earlier) and the newly released [http://www.wireshark.org/docs/relnotes/wireshark-1.2.0.html 1.2.0pre1]
  * The Wireshark [https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=3166 bug] that spawned support 

==pcap-ng File Format==
  * As of writing, the current draft specification is [http://www.winpcap.org/ntar/draft/PCAP-DumpFileFormat.html here], and is subject to change at any time
  * A number of sample captures, containing several different protocols, link-layer types and format features are available on our [http://code.google.com/p/understand/downloads/list Downloads] page (tagged with "ntar" and "pcapng")
  * Additional sample files are available at [http://wiki.wireshark.org/Development/PcapNg this page] on the Wireshark Wiki 

===Mailing Lists===
Evolution of the pcap-ng file format is driven by several mailing lists. These are splintered between the following:
  * [http://www.mail-archive.com/wireshark-dev@wireshark.org/ wireshark-dev]
  * [http://www.winpcap.org/pipermail/ntar-workers ntar-workers]

==Universal Disk Format (UDF)==
  * The current steward/maintainer of the UDF specifications is the [http://www.osta.org Optical Storage Technology Association (OSTA)], who currently make them freely available [http://www.osta.org/specs/ here] as PDF files
  * Some information on various implementations is curated on the [UDFInteroperabilityTesting] page of this wiki
  * Additional factoids and information on UDF are also available over at [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Disk_Format Wikipedia]
